thread.title: Inactives: Vikings' Peterson in, Lions' Wilson out
thread.title_full: Inactives: Vikings' Peterson in, Lions' Wilson out

author: freep.com
title: Inactives: Vikings' Peterson in, Lions' Wilson out
text:
MORE Sick or not, Adrian Peterson will be on the field for the Minnesota Vikings today.
Peterson, who was added to the injury report on Saturday as questionable because of an illness, will play today for the Vikings against the Detroit Lions.
The Lions ruled out nickel cornerback Josh Wilson, who suffered a brain injury late in last week's win over the Chicago Bears. Starters DeAndre Levy (hip) and Brandon Pettigrew (knee) also are out for the Lions, though Joique Bell, Haloti Ngata, Eric Ebron and James Ihedigbo are all back after missing at least one game with injury.
Lions-Vikings live blog here! Ngata, in particular, will be in the spotlight today as the Lions try and contain Peterson, who ran for a season-high 134 yards in Minnesota's 26-16 win over the Lions last month.
Quandre Diggs and Isa Abdul-Quddus will play as the ' fifth cornerback in the Lions' nickel package
Corey Robinson, Michael Ola, Gabe Wright and Khyri Thornton also are inactive for the Lions (1-5).
Defensive tackle Sharrif Floyd is inactive for the Vikings (3-2).
Contact Dave Birkett at dbirkett@freepress.com. Follow him on Twitter @davebirkett .
